meanings.definition: A person or thing that boggles.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was a boggler when it came to solving puzzles.
meanings.sent2: The magician's tricks were real boggling for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The boggler cat chased its tail in circles, amusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: The maze of mirrors was a boggler, reflecting endless images.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was a true boggler for the viewers.

meanings.definition: Something that causes confusion or bewilderment.
meanings.sent1: The complex riddle was a real bogglers for the students.
meanings.sent2: The new technology can be a bogglers for older generations.
meanings.sent3: Trying to understand advanced calculus can be a real bogglers!
meanings.sent4: The city streets turned into a maze, a true bogglers for the lost tourists.
meanings.sent5: The conflicting instructions were a complete bogglers for the team.
